trends: There have been 74 other sightings in St Louis
There were no other sightings in St Louis on or around October 29th 2011
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsi had just sat down at about 8:50 pm cdt in my south st. louis city backyard on saturday 10\29, facing west, when i noticed a lower altitude light in the sky slowly crossing left to right in front of me, very slightly gaining altitude. it was distinctive in appearance, like a 4th of july roman candle, yellow-orange-white in color. there appeared to be a smaller white light with it, as if it could be another light on a craft. it was not distinctive in size, about the size of lower elevation plane approaching the st. louis airport 6 miles away. the craft was yet slightly increasing in altitude. there were no blinking lights, and no discernible sound. i watched it for a few seconds after i'd noticed it and thought it was bright enough and moving slowly enough that i could run in my house, get my camera and take a picture of it. i've never seen a craft with lights like that before and i'm 51, but again, it was more anomalous than surreal. stepping back outside several seconds later, i got the object in the viewfinder and zoomed in the full 24x optical resolution. i clearly saw a fuzzy circular object, but not with the extending "rays" i was seeing with my eyes. when i pressed the auto-focus, immediately i could no longer see the object in the frame, nor did i see the object move out of the frame. i looked with my eye and noticed the object had significantly dimmed down. the object was not dimming while i could see it with my eyes. the object apparently dimmed down to the point the camera could not pick it up exactly at the time i depressed the auto-focus! i continued to look at the object with my eyes after i tried to take its picture, where i finally did actually see it dim out, quickly, though still rising in altitude - which a chinese lantern wouldn't do. july 4th of 2009 and 2010 i and others did see "chinese lanterns" pass by the house, but this object looked more like a steady burning roman candle with a small white light right beside it. the included "picture" is a "photoshop" hybrid image of a picture taken at night of my perspective from the event night, with software overlayed anomalous light(s). i would testify that the image is over 90 percent accurate of what i saw with my eyes before i got my camera that night.
